attributes.background: Hare coursing is a traditional sport and was made illegal. However banning it has led to an increase in offences such as poaching. If it were to be made legal again it would be much more convenient to farmers, police and all others.

attributes.action: Devolve responsibility of railways in Scotland
attributes.background: The Scottish Government should have responsibility for all rail in Scotland. People are fed up of rail fare increases, delays and cancellations.
attributes.additional_details:
Scotland could then have the power to nationalise the railways, if we want to and cap on rail fares.
Scotland must be an equal partner in all agreements for rail than runs from England into Scotland and have full power and responsibility over all rail in Scotland.

attributes.action: Make placenta and cord donation optional at all hospitals!
attributes.background: By donating your cord blood after the birth of your baby you could save someone's life. Any ladies can donate stem cells by giving away their umbilical cord and placenta after you have given birth. Stuff that's usually just put in a clinical waste bin and incinerated really could save a life.
attributes.additional_details: The only issues to this are only certain centres in the UK are using the fairly new scheme.

attributes.action: Allow motorcyclists with a valid CBT (aged 17+) to have up to a 300cc.
attributes.background:
New motorcyclists from aged 17 are forced to ride up to a 125cc and have a maximum power output of 11kw. This is very low and can be unsafe, similar to mopeds as they're normally restricted to 28 MPH.

This limit has been proven unsafe in many circumstances and should be reconsidered.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.quora.com/Are-125cc-motorcycles-good-for-beginners-or-should-one-choose-a-250cc-instead

Although the jump in power might seem ridiculous upon first viewing, but perhaps the government should look at how other countries treat new motorcyclists; along with additional training and theory.

We deserve more freedom and you can learn a lot more with the extra power, making it safer for riders and for them to gain advanced skills at an early stage.

We need more variation upon the market.

attributes.action: Introduce KS2 SATs Science to ALL primary schools
attributes.background: This will help children know more knowledge about science for Secondary School.

attributes.action: Make handling food without disposable gloves an offence
attributes.background: This is a petition to make handling food in the food industry without gloves an offence, reasons for this are; its disgusting and off-putting, it increases the risk of spreading germs and catching illness. Its unhygenic and needs to be changed.

attributes.action: Make store return policies more flexible by law
attributes.background: Consumerism is unfair enough to us already, and hugely profitable companies should give us the benefit of the doubt when returning products.
attributes.additional_details: They should not refuse to refund resalable items on the basis that, without a receipt, it may have come from another store. Faith in humanity should be sufficient proof of purchase. Visibly unused products should not be doubted. Store credit is not an option. We need more lenient, flexible return policies.

attributes.action: Reopen the UK embassy in Damascus
attributes.background: After closing the embassy in 2011 due to the war, the British Government should now reopen their embassy in Damascus, the Syrian Capital, as the war draws to a close. Reopening the embassy and restoring ties with Syria could produce cooperation in regards to Islamist terror, and help rebuild Syria.
attributes.additional_details: The restoration of ties with Syria and the reopening of an embassy there would have significant benefits, both for Britain and the people of Syria. We have embassies in all neighbouring countries of Syria, including Iran, Saudi Arabia, and Iraq, and now that Damascus is safe and stable, it's time we restored the British Embassy. Trade, cooperation in regards to terrorism and ISIS, reconstruction, intelligence, and investment could thrive as a result. The British embassy in Syria should reopen.

attributes.action: Introduce anonymous Individual Voluntary Arrangements as law
attributes.background: At present time, if a personal is struggling with debt and want to enter an IVA it is presented on a formal register for as long as 6 years. This disadvantages the persons employment and housing opportunities. See https://www.iva-advice.co/pros-and-cons.html for background.

attributes.action: Label all ingredients (including soy oil) and create a soy tax
attributes.background: There are many people suffering from multiple food allergies, soy being one of the main culprits. It is hidden under more than 70 different names. I myself have purchased a product labelled 100% turkey and ended up in hospital because soy oil was not labelled. Allergies need to be taken seriously.
attributes.additional_details: I have emailed the supplier of this product and all they have done is acknowledge they had soy oil in the product and offered a £4 refund. This is not enough. I was ill for a month. This is serious. Prepackaged food is over processed and has added soy in for no beneficial reason other than the fact it is a cheap alternative for the manufacturers. There is a sugar tax in action and I think there should also be a soy tax.

attributes.action: Widening of M62 East bound bottleneck between junction 10 and 11
attributes.background: The M62 bottlenecks from 3 lanes down to 2 whilst meeting the mighty M6. The problem has been around for longer than the 20 years I've been using it and we're currently having smart motorways installed but it feels this is outdated and needs further future proofing
attributes.additional_details: 10 or 20 years ago my commute was similar but we still had the same problem, the M62 bottleneck. We used to say "if you're not in the motorway for 7:00am, forget it". These times have changed over the years, which I could imagine being down to flexitime being introduced and you now have to be on the motorway a lot earlier to have a chance. However, the majority of us have been and gone by 8:30am - 9:00am.

attributes.action: Give women right to paid leave to attend cervical screening appointments.
attributes.background: Women shouldn’t have to worry about taking time off of work for cervical screening. Loosing pay or not having enough holiday entitlement are horrific reasons women do not get screened. Companies should promote cervical screening by offering paid time off for it. This should be government backed.
attributes.additional_details:
Every year in the UK, over 3,000 women will be diagnosed with cervical cancer. Cervical cancer is the most common cancer in women aged 35 and under.

Many companies will expect you to book off time as annual leave or take it unpaid and only a small amount allow time for such appointments without hinderance. This is an added pressure on top of the already scary process. 
 
For such treatment I think employees should be free to not worry about their employer expecting them to book the time off.

attributes.action: Reduce timeframe insurance companies can use expired points against motorists
attributes.background: Insurance companies demand drivers to declare penalty points after the law states they have expired,
attributes.additional_details:
Currently if you receive points that expire in 3 years insurance companies demand to inform them for 5 years. This is just a way to boost premiums. Let’s change the law so that once points expire they cannot be used against you by insurance companies. 
Points valid for 3 years stay on licence for 4 only for court information, a driver should not have to declare them once they reach the expiry date.

attributes.action: All kids in Secondary School should have the choice to have P.E. as a lesson.
attributes.background:
Kids from Year 7 to Year 11 should have the choice to do P.E. or not.
Reason because the P.E. kit for most schools are to expensive and some parents can't afford it so kids should have the choice about P.E. Kids can either chose to not have P.E. as a lesson or they can have the chose to do it.

Kids from Year 7 to Year 11 should have the choice to do P.E. or not.
Reason because the P.E. kit for most schools are to expensive and some parents can't afford it so kids should have the choice about P.E. Because it's to much money for parents witch means kid are getting detention for not haveing there P.E. kit so it would be mutch appreciated if you sign this petition and make it a thing.

attributes.action: Stop putting fluoride in our waters
attributes.background: We are told that fluoride is helpful for our teeth. But in some cases too much fluoride can do damage to teeth instead. We are drinking, eating and bathing in a small amount of this substance believing it’s better for ourselves.
attributes.additional_details:
I’ve also seen a clear differences when switching toothpastes. All my life, I have been using fluoride toothpaste however i switched to a non-flouridated toothpaste, and my teeth went whiter quick.
 
Please search up details why fluoride is terrible and question your beliefs about fluoride.

attributes.action: Simplify planning use classes by combine A1, A2, B1 and D1.
attributes.background: Planning requires change of use, which is expensive.  This is just red-tape.  Many categories overlaps.
